topic.title: Idea discussion: FireZero
topic.body:
You know what would be cool? A mix of FireChat and ZeroNet technology.
That way our distributed network would be completely independent from the internet, governments, laws and other crap like that =D
Do you think it can ever happen?))))

topic.title: Button "Pause all"
topic.body:
I think, ZeroHello needs a "Pause all" button inside a main dropdown menu to save traffic on limited connections without closing ZNet or the connection.

A small but comfortable option, I think.

An alternative is to make an "update all" button wich woulf update even paused sites. (This may be even better).

topic.title: tasks app
topic.body: is there any ZeroNet tasks app with encrypted database?

1_15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ.body: Hi, a brief search about this topic spotted nothing interesting, so I tried to do it on my own. Result: falure. Anyone was more lucky?
My idea was to download all the components and add them to QPython app. Seems it does not work that way(
As far as I understand, there is no need to create a client. It's created already. Problem is in Python.
write me on ZeroMail if you find something out
I mean, it's totally awesome, thank you! now I wander wether or not I can launch IPFS and Twister this way XD

it was fast at first, but slowed down to barely bareable pretty soon. I'll tend to this problem after some sleep. It's 6:49 here already xD
But man, it's awesome anyway! Look: Year 2016: people can host a distributed network from their watch.
No, I do it from a tablet, but never the less, fact is fact.

now it's unbareable. I was able to curse twice, take a screenshot, upload it and come back here just as my message appeared. And most of connections end up with timeout, so I guess the message will have a hard time gitting out of my device xD
anyway, screenshot: https://ipfs.pics/QmR6QjZ8ZUAYTtcrkNnefKw71qeU9BpMU88Zc27JdQwrEu

now it works alright. still some synchronysation errors due to timeout, and overal speed is not high. Have to use Yandex.Browser or Chrome, and even they lag from time to time. But I can live with that. Battery consumption is not so high (about 10% per night's sleep and 10% per hour of work) so yea, everything seems fine. quite usable!

AND it will be awesome on @scrub's PC, I think =D
Sometimes it's even as fast as PC.

-_- read HowTo on GitHub.
You don't need to install Python separately as far as I remember.
And you will have to copy downloaded .tar with
cp /host-root/sdcard/[where you put the .tar] ~
cd ~

*I'm not sure about /host-root/...
Please check the folder with "ls" command.

I've just discovered that /sdcard/GNUROOT/ is Debian's /, which means you can copy and unpack tar with any Android tool of you want. But I've told you how to do it from console if anything goes wrong with this option.

P.S. It is easier to unpack with a console ("tar...") if you don't have any tool for .tar.gz files.

Very strange. Have you tried some other network? Besides closed port is not a problem. I can't open ports on my network no matter what I do, but everything is working alright.

More , on droid you can try you mobile provider's network.

P.S. wanted to notify you on ZeroMail, but it could not find your username. Strange.

@lulzsec What does it show in the browser?
Can you explain in short how you installed it?

https://webtorrent.io seem to be a solution for now, but that means more presure on existing seeders, because web player will not store data for long, and another question is disk space usage... how to control it with a web player?

EDIT: ok, nlw I see. A limited storage. Streaming works, but I can't fast forward to a point that I want to watch if it's a few minutes ahead. In case of a film that would such a big black duck.
is it possible to embed IPFS files into zeronet sites? if yes, I think, problem's solved =D Big files usually are static =)

I return here to state that IPFS and ZeroNet work fine together. I can even embed pictures from IPSF.pics or IPFS.io
But to use local IPFS, I had to post pictures this way: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiAFnnf6kb2G1GzDV1FhttTWNxCa4mShn/?Post:3:Today's%20troubles

Speaking about streaming larger files - it's still a debate. I can host them (direct download), but not sure about streaming them.

So... Concluding all said, there are a lot of ways to send and stream files even if large file support won't be implemented on ZeroNet.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CiAFnnf6kb2G1GzDV1FhttTWNxCa4mShn/?Post:9:Streaming+with+IFPS/

FUCK ME! IT'S WORKING! IT'S WORKING! AND I'M THE FIRST ONE WHO'S DONE IT RIGHT!

CENTRALIZE MY ASS NOW!

1_19R2USgb9vPyg1jPQEJkGVoBwDuDcEmHRF.body: Special torrents? So it's another IPFS? Why on earth would anyone use that?

> [jdoig](#comment_3_1D33SjywZjLd2QdRgzYMprcxZPva9FGZ3h): I'm building one for a project.It uses ZeroNet and Tor to host the main site then a webtorrent-hybrid server to seed the media (site visitors will also seed as the browse the site). 
> The idea is to allow YouTube style sites without every user having to permanently store gigs of video, they just seed while they use the site and I can worry about being the initial seed via a webtorrent-hybrid running on my machine.

The problem here is that if they won't carry all those Gs of data, who will? You? You say "initial seed", but if people will only carry videos as long as they are on your site, there won't remain no other seeder bht the initial. If you have solved this problem, I'm willing to read about it, if not - go use IPFS.

> [nofish](#comment_506_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): webtorrent runs in your browser no external plugin/application needed

As far as I remember, it requires a plugin inside a browser (I may be wrong here), but let's suppose that it does not.

Then there is a question, how can a user control those files? Will they be just piled on his drive (bad for user) or will tbey be deleted after he watched the video (bad for network)? Where can a user setup it if there is no plugin?

And in case you forgot about it, unlike uTorrent, qBittorrent, IPFS, Maelstrom, ZNet and any other p2p system, a common browser is not run in the background (usually) and without a plugin (and sometimes with it too), you can't change this behaviour.

So I'm asking you too, with all the respect ofcourse, what is the trick? Where to seek for a bad news? Will it be an unstable network, dependant on the initial seeder, or will it be and uncontrollable pile of files and lots of data upload/download for the user?

> [jdoig](#comment_4_1D33SjywZjLd2QdRgzYMprcxZPva9FGZ3h): @musickiller is sounds like you are asking people working on their own projects for their own reasons to solve either your own problems or the entire distributed web's problems. Chill out, if IPFS is working out for you then cool, good for you :)

Nope, I'm just saying that it is better for peer network if everyone use the same app. That's it)

I don't actually ask to solve the problem, it was a way to point it out. And see if a man has anything to offer besides his awesome ideas. For awesome ideas I have myself, but some cool new thing instead of IPFS I'm searching indeed.

// but I agree that I should have written it somehow difderent. Sorry, really. It's morning here. And not a nice one.

> [kaffie](#comment_71_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): IPFS seems like a better way to go, but I found it was really slow to stream content. I dunno if that was because I didn't set it up right, or if it was just legit slow.

I suppose, not enough seeders. For me IPFS is usually slow on the initial stage, but then it is as fast as anything else.

> Personally, I like the idea of regular torrents, so that users can freely use a torrent client of their choice, or use the built in one. But AFAIK there's no JS tool to stream them yet.

Me too. Simple = Good at this context. For sure I would use that one if it was available.

About the idea itself, it's really good as a support for a centralized or decentralized network, not distributed. If Youtube for example would use your tool, they would need much less ppwer for their servers =))

May be you can sell it?))))))))

> marcolo: How to keep a site as small as possible?

In either case, you can keep it small by using external place to keep files. For example, [my forum](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.musickiller.bit/?Home) is filled with different content (list you can find in Blog Roadmap), everything is accessable and distributed, but still weights only 556 KB. Wich means you can access it on a mobile connection just as well as on any other.

2_17n5jg4bBEoWodXDf8L4Y2u88ShagS272Y.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_82_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Double spend is still  an issue, obviously. Since the blockchain/bitcoin is the first solution to that problem. Cryptocurrencies are unique because they guarantee that the coin is unique and unable to be spent twice with no central authority. You either need a central authority to validate, or you need to trust the users (either client).

I think it is possible to use NXT here, but that means 1 NXT per action. Not much at all, 10 NXT ~= 9 cents, but still money. But I think it's possible to compress data and send several actions per "message". You can define hundreds of actions for single message (1000 symbols?).

Pluses: you can keep all data you need in the blockchain, accounts also can be stored in NXT for security
Minuses: as all blockchain-based stuff, it is a standalone, several GB big application.

I think a server is a simplier solution, but it's good to know alternatives =)

ok, fine, I blocked clearnet on my droid. However FFox is so slow tgat I'm not sure I like it.

So after playing a bit with it, I am thinking about reversing to previous settings...

> So, one of the best things to do is:clone the apps, but also be prepared to merge new stuff in the future

cloning apps is a cool option. I can make myself as much storage as I want and I won't need to store other's data =)

By "slow" I mean that smooth scroll makes whole page freeze, and when I erase several symbols, it freezes a bit and erases after I release the button. Sometimes it cleans the whole post when I want to erase a couple of sentences.

5_15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ.body:
> [erkan](#comment_113_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): See ZeroTodos:

thanks!

But it only allow simple one line notes. I hope to find something to replace Google Keep (at least, at best - to replace Evernote).

I guess someone will make it sooner or later =)

> [erkan](#comment_113_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): See ZeroTodos:

How do you manage to be everywhere? =D Or is it just your special ZeroNet ability?)

> [ekaterina](#comment_135_1Mk5sVKeCrwMc3wSD11jM7DZTiqF5D9BaD): I'm working on that :) I actually created something that looks a lot like Google Keep not related to ZeroNet some time ago, but never released it. When I find the time I will modify it to run on ZeroNet, could take a month or two though, I've already got too much work on my hands with my current ZeroNet sites :)

is there a list with your ZN sites?)

I'll wait. I need some secure place to store info away from corporations...

> [erkan](#comment_115_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): If ZeroTodos (with its 30.0kb storage) is not to your liking:you can always use mail@zeroverse for that, by sending mails to yourself.You have 1953K storage there ;-)

hm... It sounds stupid, but you are actually right. It will be hard to browse through those notes though.

> [ekaterina](#comment_136_1Mk5sVKeCrwMc3wSD11jM7DZTiqF5D9BaD): They are all in the sidebar of my ZeroNet development blog in the "My projects" section: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Kp5xdjQyrPth5mEJsn6NDBKZxcaeYz86N/
> And there are already five more sites planned, including the notes app :) I need to do some more work on ZeroQuotes and ZeroTodos, ZeroPolls is already in a really good state, then I'll start work on the next site.

thanks!

> [ekaterina](#comment_136_1Mk5sVKeCrwMc3wSD11jM7DZTiqF5D9BaD): 

By the way, you should add .bit name from your site. Currently to share your site to other devices I have to copy the link to some place like google keep and then open it on other machines through the same g.keep, but if there was some blog.ekaterina.bit, I would just enter the address =) very comfortable!
